subtitle: hi I'm Simon Jacobsen and welcome to
meaningful Monday's where we answer your
personal questions the question for this
week is a seemingly hopeless alcoholic I
am an alcoholic I have tried to get
sober through the 12 steps and I just
can't do it it's ruining my life but I
can't seem to stay sober what else can I
try not knowing all the details behind
this question let me respond to the tone
and to the between the lines that I pick
up here there are people who seem to
feel that their life is hopeless
there's nowhere to go whatever they try
has not worked at the same time
continuing the life of an addiction
whether it's alcoholism or there's drugs
or it's other type of self-destructive
behavior is ruining their life so being
stuck between a rock and a hard place
being that we believe absolutely and
firmly in the resilience of the human
spirit and the dignity of the human soul
means that there's no such thing as
hopeless period the question is how do
you access how do you ignite that pilot
flame that all of us have burning even
when things seem like there's no way out
the simplest and best way is to connect
to something that's beyond ourselves
because we are often our own worst
enemies so there's a hasidic expression
that says when you're tied above you
don't fall below life is very precarious
there are many dangers that are lurking
especially when we left to our own
devices and our subjective devices
including our addictions it gets very
difficult to manage so when we tie
ourselves to something above which
simply means a spiritual connection to
something that's greater than yourself a
commitment to your traditions a
commitment to a faith and a trust in a
force that's greater than yourself these
are forces that hold us strong so even
when we are on slippery slopes we don't
fall so my response to you is you must
find within yourself something that you
can hold on to that's greater than
yourself I mean to
say that you've tried this and tried
that and nothing is working so you have
to try other things but you cannot give
up in any given way on your life because
the fact that matter is the greatest
tragedy of all is the loss of your own
destiny of your own calling and
betraying yourself which is worse than
any form of betrayal so may God bless
you with the string that you need in the
fortitude to forge ahead and to try to
find some glimmer of hope look for
friends look for people that you're not
accustomed to something new in your life
some new commitment new friend that can
bring in fresh air and hopefully that
can be that force that can keep you
afloat even when things seem so bleak
this has been meaningful Mondays if
